Expectation1: Support each other emotionally during tough times
Situation1: One sibling has just received some very difficult news and is deeply distressed by it.
Situation2: Both have several free evenings this week and can choose any for a date.
Story: I sat on the edge of my bed, phone in hand, staring at two unread messages. My stepbrother’s text was raw and desperate—he’d just found out his dad was seriously ill, and he needed someone to talk to. I could almost hear his voice cracking, and I knew he expected me to be there, to listen, to help him hold it together. At the same time, my boyfriend’s message was light and hopeful, asking which night I wanted to go out this week. He’d been looking forward to us finally having time together, and I could picture his smile, the way he’d planned something special just for us. My heart twisted as I thought about how much I wanted to be with him, to laugh and forget everything for a while. But I also couldn’t ignore my stepbrother’s pain. The weight of both expectations pressed down on me, and I felt torn in two, unable to figure out how to be what both of them needed right now.
